title: Join Me
text:
Eager to make Honolulu better? Volunteer alongside me:
## Interest Form
I direct small teams tackling real policy challenges. Past volunteers report improving their knowledge of government, civic skills, and professional connections.
Excellent volunteers often become mentees, whom I help to select and secure long-term, high-impact roles in government or community service.

title: Well, hi. I‚Äôm Trey. üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
text:
Well, hi. I‚Äôm Trey. üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
I‚Äôm a father of 2, an Abundance Democrat, and a citizen-scholar based in Honolulu, Hawaii.
At work, I study and write about how state and local governments can deliver better results.
Outside of work, I put good ideas into practice as a member of boards and commissions. And I help good policymakers win elections with the Oahu Democrats.
Interested? I want to hear from you: trey@gogordner.com

title: Meet Trey
text:
Trey‚Äôs Story
Trey was born in 1990 to two public servants: Marv, then a young Army officer, and Kim, a special education teacher. From an early age, Trey enjoyed advocating for his peers through student government. He graduated near the top of his class from Jack Britt High School in Hope Mills, North Carolina, and was honored with the statewide DAR Good Citizen Award that same year.
Trey studied international business in college with the goal of helping nonprofits become more effective and efficient. Along the way, he decided to start a company of his own that would make the world a better place. Two years after graduation, he founded Koios Library Software, which he ran for 6 years, growing it from an idea (to help public libraries reach their communities through Google) to a successful small business with 40 clients in the U.S. and Canada.
Inspired by the intelligence and determination of the librarians he met, Trey returned to the classroom for a ‚Äúdeep dive‚Äù into the workings of state and local government, focusing on land use, housing, and data analytics. During this time, he also worked as a researcher in economic development, helping distressed communities create more opportunity for local residents.
After graduation, Trey completed a two-year fellowship that used his technology skills to help create a more effective, equitable Federal government. He next accelerated temporary housing development after the Maui wildfires for Governor Josh Green. Now at UHERO he helps policymakers find new ways to make housing in Hawaii more affordable and the people of Hawaii more prosperous.
He met his wife, Andrea‚Äìa fellow public servant‚Äìat an engagement party for mutual friends in 2014, and they were married in 2016. Their son, Winston, was born at Queens in 2022 and their daughter, Evangeline, in 2024. They live in Ewa Beach.

title: Meet Trey
text:
Trey‚Äôs Background

Career
Policy Researcher/Data Scientist, UHERO, June 2024-Present

Education

Bachelor of International Business & Entrepreneurship, University of South Carolina, 2009-2013


Community Service
Commissioner, Honolulu Charter Commission
Board Member, Hawaii Community Development Authority
Member, Ewa Neighborhood Board
District Chair, Oahu Democrats
Guest Lecturer, University of Hawaii
